clinical_study.brief_title: Association of Anemia With Hospital Costs in Elective Colorectal Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Association of Anemia With Hospital Costs in Elective Colorectal Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The objective is to measure the adjusted association between preoperative anemia and total hospital costs. We hypothesize that patients with anemia before surgery will have higher hospitalization costs than people without anemia.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will examine the association between preoperative anemia (hematocrit less than 0.39; low blood counts) and hospital total costs from elective colorectal surgery. Total costs will be defined as the combination of direct and indirect costs ascertained using standardized patient-level costing algorithms (i.e. the standard way that hospital measure their costs). Adjustment will be made for factors that are likely to influence both the presence of anemia and costs of care.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Hospital admission to date of discharge from hospital, or 365 days after admission, whichever came first
primary_outcome.description: Direct and indirect costs accrued during the index hospitalization

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Date of surgery to date of hospital discharge, or up to one year after surgery (whichever comes first)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days in hospital after surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Hospital admission to date of surgery, or 365 days after admission, whichever came first
secondary_outcome.description: Any red blood cell transfusion received

arm_group.description: People with a preoperative hematocrit less than 0.39
People with a preoperative hematocrit greater than or equal to 0.39

study_pop.textblock: All adults having elective colorectal surgery with national surgical quality improvement program data available

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Elective hospital admission
- having colorectal surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- not enrolled in national surgical quality improvement program data collection
